ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours
There was no work involved.
2 hours prepare the seminar speakers talk.
1 hour

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Overall, it is a good course! It offers exposure to a selection of research topics in Biostatistics beyond what is learned in the typical classroom setting.
It is a great chance for me to be familiar with the update knowledge and information in biostatistics
Strengths: 1. Interesting topics 2. Adequate length of class 3. Journal club and lunch with speakers provide the opportunity for in-depth discussions of the paper

The seminar was good. One way that it could be improved would be to include more public health focused biostatisticians. There were many first semester students who were just now beginning to learn statistics and felt that they could not fully engage in the seminar because they either didn't understand the concepts in the presentation or did not spark their public health interest.
Since this course is Biostatistics Seminar, there are no homework. However, it's better to discuss the paper in advance before the seminar speaker's talk.
The seminars this semester is much more interesting than those in last academic year. May be proved by inviting more distinguished speakers.
The course provides us a chance to learn what biostatisticians are doing in their real research. It is a very good course.
good overall

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  All the instructors are knowledgeable and insightful and are willing to share their experience with us.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  N/A
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Dr. Crawford is really nice and helpful!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Excellent
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor is very responsible for the organizing the course.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  good overall

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Overall, nice exposure to various research topics.
I will recommend this course to other student, it is worth your time
N/A - required for Biostatistics
I would recommend it to other students. This seminar course is excellent. I have learnt l lot of research methods and interesting topics.
Excellent
A very good course. Worth taking.
yes
